com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface deleteOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface deleteOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document deleteOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The deleteOrder API is used to delete an order or order lines.

    • Method Detail

      • deleteOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document deleteOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                 org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                          throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                 java.rmi.RemoteException

        The deleteOrder API is used to delete an order or order lines. An order is deleted automatically if all of its lines are deleted.

        See Additional Information for example scenarios.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exit:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSOrderRepricingUE

        Events Raised: These events are raised under transaction ORDER_CHANGE.
        DELETE_ORDER:

          This event is raised prior execution of deleteOrder.
          Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.DELETE_ORDER.xml
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
          Template Support - Yes
          Configuration Required for Backward Compatability - No

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Additional Information:

        Example Scenarios


          Two or more product lines

            If one PROD line is to be deleted, the other line will not be deleted. If they have a ship together or deliver together constraint, the constraint is removed. Before deleting, the line is cancelled. This ensures that all inventory, taxes, and charge updates are reversed.

          A product line associated with a delivery service line

            If only the delivery service line is deleted the delivery service line is then cancelled, ensuring that all capacity, taxes, and charge updates are reversed. The delivery service line is then deleted and the association between the product line and the delivery service line is removed. However, deletion of a DS line associated with a PROD line that has a child order is not allowed. The child order must be cancelled first manually and only then DS line can be deleted.

          Two product lines associated with a delivery line

            If one product line is deleted, the association between the product line and the delivery service line is removed. The the delivery service line is not deleted since it is still associated with other product line. If the delivery service line is deleted, both product lines are unscheduled and the delivery service line is then cancelled. The delivery service line is then deleted. If both product lines are deleted, the delivery service line is also deleted.

          A product line associated with a provided service line

            If the provided service line is deleted, the product line is not deleted. If both lines are scheduled, they are unscheduled. The association is removed and the PS line is deleted. If the product line is deleted, the provided service line is automatically deleted.

          Line links to child order

            Any orders linked to the order line are cancelled but not deleted. Examples of linked orders are procurement orders, chained orders, and work orders. If the child order cannot be cancelled, the parent order line cannot be deleted. If a work order cannot be cancelled, the parent order can be cancelled if the CANCEL_PARENT_AFTER_WO_COMPLETION rule is set to Y.

          Payment processing

            Please ensure that you undo all the authorizations and charges on the order before deleting the order.

          All Bundle Component lines are deleted

            If all bundle component lines are deleted then bundle parent line will also be deleted.

          Related lines

            When two lines have a relationship, if either or both lines are deleted, then the relationship is deleted.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document containing the latest order details and the audit details made to the order. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
